phase.name: TOON Infrastructure
phase.purpose: Create parser and compiler toolchain that transforms TOON source into Claude Code compliant output

step.name: Infrastructure Integration Tests
step.description:
Create end-to-end integration tests for the complete TOON toolchain.

CRITICAL BLOCKER: TOON version mismatch MUST be resolved first.
- Test fixture (agents/novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) uses TOON v1.0
- Parser may expect TOON v3.0
- DECISION REQUIRED: Convert fixture OR update parser to support v1.0

Integration tests validate: parse → template selection → rendering → output validation.
step.motivation: Integration tests validate all components work together

constraints: DO NOT CREATE NEW REPORT FILES
DO NOT COMMIT BEFORE USER APPROVAL
Tests use business language and domain concepts
Type system makes wrong state non-representable

success_criteria_mapping.SC2: Build produces Claude Code compliant output

acceptance_criteria: Integration test compiles novel-editor TOON file successfully (after version compatibility resolved)
Integration test validates output structure against type-specific schemas
Integration test verifies error propagation from parser → compiler → output
Test uses real TOON file (agents/novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) with NO mocks

tdd_approach.outer_test:
GIVEN the existing novel-editor TOON file
WHEN I compile it through the full pipeline
THEN output is valid Claude Code agent.md

workflow: 0. PREREQUISITE CHECK: Verify tools/toon/ exists. If not: HALT - refer to BLOCKER_001 resolution
5. DO NOT COMMIT - wait for user approval

test_scope.mocking_policy: NO MOCKS - Integration test uses real implementations
test_scope.validation_depth: End-to-end: TOON file input → valid agent.md output with all required sections

adversarial_review.blast_radius: CRITICAL - Integration test failure blocks entire phase completion, may invalidate 5 prior implementations

contradictions_found.statement_1: Parser implementation (step 1.1) expects TOON v3.0 format per spec
contradictions_found.statement_2: Test fixture (novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) uses TOON v1.0 format
contradictions_found.impact: Test WILL FAIL on first run. Parser either rejects v1.0 or accepts incorrectly. If accepts, validates wrong format.
contradictions_found.failure_scenario: Parser silently succeeds on v1.0 but missing v3.0 features. Integration test passes. Code ships. Production fails when v3.0 features needed.

contradictions_found.statement_2: Output structure specification does not exist in task or referenced tasks
contradictions_found.statement_3: No way to validate structure without specification
contradictions_found.impact: Test cannot be written. Implementation will guess. Acceptance criteria cannot be verified.

contradictions_found.contradiction: Test scope ambiguity creates validation false-positives
contradictions_found.statement_1: Outer test claims to validate 'full pipeline end-to-end'
contradictions_found.statement_2: If components are mocked, it's not end-to-end
contradictions_found.statement_3: If components are real, test depends on all 5 prior implementations being correct
contradictions_found.statement_4: No specification of which failures should propagate vs be caught
contradictions_found.impact: Green test results could hide failures in 4/5 prior components. False confidence.

contradictions_found.statement_1: 2 hours estimated for integration test creation
contradictions_found.statement_2: Requires understanding: TOON v1.0 AND v3.0, parser output format, template rendering, markdown structure, all error types from 5 components
contradictions_found.statement_3: 2 hours insufficient for learning all prerequisites + implementation + debugging
contradictions_found.impact: Will either create incomplete test or exceed estimate by 100%+. Pressure to cut corners.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Test fixture (novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) is in correct location and accessible
dangerous_assumptions.danger: Path not documented. If wrong location, test setup fails. May fail silently if path check missing.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Parser from step 1.1 is complete and working
dangerous_assumptions.danger: If step 1.1 incomplete or has bugs, integration test fails non-deterministically. Can't distinguish parser bug from integration bug.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Template system (steps 1.2-1.4) outputs deterministic, validatable structure
dangerous_assumptions.danger: If template rendering is non-deterministic or inconsistent, output validation fails. No specification to validate against.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Error propagation is simple and well-defined
dangerous_assumptions.danger: Real systems have error translation layers, wrapping, logging. Error from component A might be caught, logged, and re-raised as different type. Test assumes direct propagation.
Different implementations may produce valid but structurally different outputs. Test may be too strict (rejects valid) or too loose (accepts invalid).

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Prior steps (1.1-1.5) completed and integrated correctly
dangerous_assumptions.danger: No integration point validation. Steps may have incomplete interfaces, version mismatches, missing exports.

circular_dependencies.cycle: Output specification → Integration test → Output specification validation
circular_dependencies.description: Task says test should 'validate output structure', but output structure is undefined. Test implementation will define the structure, then test validates its own implementation.

circular_dependencies.description: Integration test requires step 1.5 compiler to be done and working. But step 1.5 might not be complete. If incomplete, integration test is meaningless (testing incomplete implementation).
circular_dependencies.impact: Can't validate integration until all steps done. Integration test becomes final verification, not intermediate check.

what_will_happen.most_likely_outcome: Integration test implementation stalls on output specification. Author spends 30+ mins trying to figure out 'what am I validating?' Implements weak validation checks that pass everything. Test gives false confidence. Real issues discovered later.
what_will_happen.second_most_likely: Parser fails on first test run due to TOON v1.0 vs v3.0 mismatch. Test blocked. Must investigate and fix parser compatibility. Schedule slips 1-2 days.
what_will_happen.third_most_likely: Test passes but doesn't test anything meaningful because (a) output structure not validated, (b) errors not actually propagated through test, (c) no error scenarios triggered. False confidence. Real bugs found in phase 2.

adversarial_review.final_verdict: DO NOT EXECUTE AS WRITTEN. Task will fail or produce meaningless test. Critical blockers exist: TOON format incompatibility, output specification missing, error scenarios undefined. Likelihood of meaningful integration test: 15%. Recommend resolving all critical gaps before implementation.

critical_gaps.issue: Outer test lacks specificity on 'valid Claude Code agent.md'
critical_gaps.impact: Test acceptance criteria too vague - implementation will struggle to know when test passes
critical_gaps.resolution: Define what 'valid Claude Code agent.md' means: file structure, required metadata sections, markdown format validation rules. Reference output specifications from steps 1.2-1.4 (templates).

critical_gaps.impact: Test setup unclear - where should test load novel-editor TOON file from?
critical_gaps.resolution: Document: agents/novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt is the fixture. Note: file uses TOON v1.0 format, verify this is compatible with parser from step 1.1 (which expects TOON v3.0 per spec)

critical_gaps.issue: No specification of expected compiler output structure
critical_gaps.impact: Acceptance criteria 'validates output structure' cannot be implemented without knowing what to validate
critical_gaps.resolution: Define the output structure: What markdown sections? What metadata format? What validation rules? Cross-reference with templates from steps 1.2-1.4.

critical_gaps.issue: Error propagation test lacks concrete examples
critical_gaps.impact: test_integration_error_propagation is ambiguous - which errors from which components?
critical_gaps.resolution: Enumerate error scenarios: (1) Parser errors (invalid TOON syntax), (2) Template errors (template not found), (3) File I/O errors (missing input file). Define expected error behavior for each.

critical_gaps.impact: Unclear if test should mock components or test end-to-end with real parser/templates
critical_gaps.resolution: Clarify: Integration tests use real implementations of parser, template, and renderer (no mocks). Test validates wiring between components works correctly, not internal component logic.

critical_gaps.impact: 2 hours estimated, but requires understanding 5 prior implementations and creating meaningful integration assertions
critical_gaps.resolution: Consider 3 hours for (1) reading implementations, (2) understanding output format, (3) designing test assertions, (4) implementing and debugging.

dependency_concerns.details: Parser spec (step 1.1) references TOON v3.0 format, but test fixture (novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) uses TOON v1.0 format. Verify parser supports v1.0 or will need fixture conversion.
Tasks 1.2-1.4 create templates but don't document their output format. Integration test needs this to validate compiler output.
Depends on 1.5 (compiler). If compiler implementation incomplete or untested, integration test cannot be meaningful.

recommendations.action: Before implementing: Verify TOON v1.0 vs v3.0 compatibility. If incompatible, either update test fixture or adjust parser spec.
recommendations.verification: Run parser against novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt and confirm structured output

recommendations.action: Document expected compiler output format by cross-referencing completed templates from 1.2-1.4
recommendations.verification: Output specification document added to task context

recommendations.action: Enumerate error propagation scenarios with concrete examples (which exceptions should propagate from which components)
Clarify scope: full end-to-end test (no mocks) vs component integration test (some mocks)

review_metadata.approval_decision: CONDITIONAL - Approve execution with critical clarifications. Task is logically sound but lacks specificity needed for clear implementation. Recommend addressing critical gaps before full implementation begins.
review_metadata.notes: Task structure follows good TDD patterns and fits logical phase progression. However, integration tests require clear specifications of what they're integrating - templates, output format, error handling - which are not documented in task. Consider creating a small 'Integration Test Specification' document that details expected compiler output structure and error scenarios before implementation.

critical_blocker.issue: TOON version mismatch between parser and test fixture
resolution_options: A) Convert agents/novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt from v1.0 to v3.0
B) Update parser (01-01) to support TOON v1.0
C) Implement version detection in parser (supports both v1.0 and v3.0)
critical_blocker.recommended: Option C (version detection) - Most flexible, no fixture changes needed
critical_blocker.validation: Run parser against test fixture before writing integration test. Parser MUST succeed.
